Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of bodies and forelegs of four-horse chariot team (added red on pole horse’s neck, trace horse’s side) galloping, to right; below, warrior with red tunic with possibly some added white and red on helmet, fallen with head twisted to face down; at left, leg of warrior (short red chiton with red greave) moving to left; at right, leg of warrior with red greave moving to right; nonsense inscriptions in empty areas.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.15)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 269, no. 53)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 392, no. B566)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 234, no. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0454) (Phase 1)
Smith C 1888 / Acquisitions of British Museum (p. 234 no. 18)
